Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; creamy white slip; interior glazed black with traces of two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of black himation with added red and black dots between brown lines on paryphe.
Curator's comments: A number of Chian chalices from Emporio (Lemos no. 1468) and Rizari (Lemos no, 1487) depict komast dancers alongside female figures dressed in long chitons and playing the double flute and tambourine (or possibly holding a wreath). Occasionally, the female figure is holding a pomegranate. On some chalices, the female figures are incised whilst on others, they are depicted in outline. The figures on the sherds from Naukratis are likely to be from similar scenes interpreted as dancers following and performing with a chorus of women.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 274, no. 723, pl. II, pl. 94)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0764) (phase 2)
